document.title: Hawaiʻi Common Core Standards for English Language Arts

98BABBB27253454AB74A9A2A5399EADC.description: Accurately use grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

F0F7F12114244D2FB75DB2D39C48D25B.description: Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).

62A9C05B868A4A94BF1D2E3EF13251C9.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better understand each of the words.

19CF3D45C3894043BD8FEF36FF1FDBB4.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary, biblical, and mythological allusions) in context.

899EC4893AA340D6A26D3895EE78CD43.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings:

5E73934035AC453BBC9E0224ECD0EB76.description: Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

450E67625ED64DEBB6BFC45688B77EF2.description: Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

66D777AAD6F94A4792FDAB5D5427A778.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., belligerent, bellicose, rebel).

8277602300FC4F4D994C1775A2A75C76.description: Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

63E4A2001D444CB6AD0DB6B2D9AAC967.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies:

8F9D4295CCDD46939DBC8F4FA3C424DA.description: Use a comma to separate coordinate adjectives .

F33772A408B8401685735D2582E7B3B6.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing:

70AA6D25EEA2488990C09A667B0A8DA1.description: Use and explain the function of simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences to signal differing relationships among ideas.

5A80515507354897A35F9983E87B7D2F.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English grammar and usage when reading, writing, or speaking:

B0787C6A85B44F40B7AECD667258AAA2.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts, demonstrating understanding of audience, task, and purpose, drawing on a full range of linguistic skills.

A5A3ABDA01A943D2918C80AE9154A39D.description: Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

3C5F4C563C894757B327DEA3F07EEE79.description: Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

BF41CC5000724EE39C59AE8D1E890D3C.description: Analyze the main ideas and supporting details presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and explain how the ideas clarify a topic, text, or issue under study.

32B0516D2335457F884DFF5FD46DA3A0.description: Acknowledge new information expressed by others and, when warranted, modify their own views.

D5B0CA5633BA4AE7810C5B0285D4C201.description: Pose questions that elicit elaboration and respond to others’ questions and comments with relevant observations and ideas that bring the discussion back on topic as needed.

8F1961B980A44ABFB9B0189001F9DE6F.description: Follow rules for collegial discussions, track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

376E78806D8240DF8F38766E23EE5099.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

75B0FE3A8047450684B73E1F777CA7AF.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacherled) with diverse partners on grade 7 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly:

283C06B3F78644D987DD110937661623.description: Follow a standard format for citation.

D1F2E819B80347C7A8F83F0DAF026BBF.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism.

EA9B3C83BF274F8CA0D3880902B62735.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

865E822D60FD4A16A5B5DAD067D53674.description: Assess the credibility and accuracy of each source.

9E6FC6A70C174156A3A890990AE52471.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively.

5DDC7992ABFB45009B9603489CA7970E.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions for further research and investigation:

A93E575429BF431FBAA84B330D042D53.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

33AF83AEA98045F28F7FEAA97BF2FF57.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and link to and cite sources as well as to interact and collaborate with others, including linking to and citing sources.

E138F792205A4BE88F118B2BDE8D1959.description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well the purpose and audience have been addressed. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of related Writing Foundations and/or Language standards.)

9458C193CE9142969089621CDDAC6B86.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

A7A5DBC1F67A4090A2B027B8B9AF6B89.description: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

235C133CEC634A62B03A107E4A3A8116.description: Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

0A907B30B72A490EA2ACB25FF433F078.description: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

D551C2190C284D5981CC90BD1AF799BC.description: Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

0D169885480347049D04879B9168DA9F.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences:

AA579F5A73874DFAA171E2BEF38EC55A.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented.

A7E3167C50C346EBA6A942651C0728C0.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

97076F9992F145E8B964C58D708CAA2E.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

6B968A2308614650B48737CF84C412CC.description: Use appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

C25A24ECD07F4FFC9D67A389689FE31C.description: Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

C2197EFF9FE141FC955BD51F337E870F.description: Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/ effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aid comprehension.

D1494369AF6B42A5BF32C162106A80C4.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content:

188447E6557D4A5A8F301507A2F8F8DF.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the argument presented, as appropriate to the task.

6DBC80FB7C854A8DB74B696278DB8662.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

4D06FC8E09EC4E39A460D1B9C8F04D28.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), reasons, and evidence.

581C530051034BD29C0034DDA3EEE738.description: Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate, credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

50692F117AB449359D4172266C41D50E.description: Organize the reasons and evidence logically.

2813517BE91F4D7EB591C2EE66610D59.description: Introduce claim(s), acknowledge  alternate claims or counterclaims.

CCC200C1A216469FA7D674DDC6B7E3F4.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence:

9646284D256C4D97A52ABD4545D95F59.description: Read and comprehend literary texts appropriately complex for grade 7.

FAC1782705A4498A80A7B83CC259CB63.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

E9F77AD413D743CEB8E1DDA4F236DEA9.description: Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history.

97FBDD3A91E645548A4C966A0FBD38C4.description: Compare and contrast a written story, drama, or poem to its audio, filmed, staged, or multimedia version, analyzing the effects of techniques unique to each medium (e.g., lighting, sound, color, or camera focus and angles in a film).

37ABA63617A94E7893945C72EC962054.description: Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the perspectives of different characters or narrators in a text.

1F5AA944C3F44681BBFC99D04350A679.description: Analyze how a drama’s or poem’s form or structure (e.g., soliloquy, sonnet) contributes to its meaning.

0E1B610C2A864E9E82177F1B9B2EC5F2.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of rhymes and other repetitions of sounds (e.g., alliteration) on a specific verse or stanza of a poem or section of a story or drama.

6E234A756E02485FB24377B115C96C5B.description: Analyze how particular literary elements of a story or drama interact, including their impact on plot.

6972FDC1CEF2468E858944C13FCCA88E.description: Incorporate the development of a theme and other story details into an objective summary of the text.

D3FA5D3D61434DB5A6CA6CC71983437E.description: Determine a theme of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text.

4A861CE1623943A0BACED999D23DA50D.description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

F409F760EFC645FA98354AB38E6E6C75.description: Read and comprehend informational texts appropriately complex for grade 7.

048BD31210084BB9A32F9BCB14B18FDB.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

C64FE348F6974CBBA1BEFCA10886EFDE.description: Analyze how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing different interpretations of facts.

97F2CA34B8B14D009E41E86AE06BF18E.description: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims.

045B26A72C53499CB21ED399CB4D69B2.description: Compare and contrast a text to an audio, video, or multimedia version of the text, analyzing each medium’s portrayal of the subject (e.g., how the delivery of a speech affects the impact of the words).

535AF5719DB442839CEEEA90568CFB95.description: Determine an author’s point of view/perspective or purpose in a text and analyze how the author distinguishes his or her position from that of others.

98D66235B0B14FAE80334A06B4257B7C.description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to the development of the ideas.

EE26E1D727C94C4F91F7ADECA424C8C1.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

4EFFFA032D37495C943BCFA44A7AB813.description: Analyze the interactions between individuals, events, and ideas in a text (e.g., how ideas influence individuals or events, or how individuals influence ideas or events).

1081CBE3CE934066B0A4EEA6EDBA03AE.description: Incorporate the development of the main/central ideas into an objective summary.

F629FC16A2C34752A723083A190740D1.description: Determine two or more main/central ideas in a text and analyze their development over the course of a text.

9EBA341D3C46449D9CCFA1735AA7804D.description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

D13BF4F3AB684852BC1BA98D906FDF85.description: Read grade-level text orally with fluency (accuracy, automaticity, and prosody) to support comprehension, in accordance with grade-level fluency norms.
